metadata.title: CVE-2017-20162 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: A vulnerability, which was classified as problematic, has been found invercel ms up to 1.x. This issue affects the function parse of the fileindex.js. The manipulation of the argument str leads to inefficient regularexpression complexity. The attack may be initiated remotely. The exploithas been disclosed to the public and may be used. Upgrading to version2.0.0 is able to address this issue. The patch is namedcaae2988ba2a37765d055c4eee63d383320ee662. It is recommended to upgrade theaffected component. The associated identifier of this vulnerability isVDB-217451.

criterions.comment: chromium-browser: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
npm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
